column2: As you go by the edges of the land, you end up walking a path in a fishing village. Even though you usually go with a cohort you're without bodyguards - you know there's no danger here. The beach is full with youth playing sport and children enjoying the water. Some are cooking fish in a clay pot. Their eyes go wide upon seeing you. They beg for you to join them in their modest feast.
Instead of just us, why not have the whole village feast on fish?
I am feeling somewhat hugry, actually...
